definitions: a further competition, election, race, etc., after a tie or inconclusive result

examples.text: he won only 49 percent of the vote, so a runoff will be held

definitions: the draining away of water (or substances carried in it) from the surface of an area of land, a building or structure, etc.

examples.text: the ratio of runoff to rainfall
fertilizer runoff from the intensively farmed areas in the river basin

shortDefinitions: draining away of water or substances carried in it from surface of area of land

definitions: the water or other material that drains freely off the surface of something

examples.text: when it rains the runoff cascades down to the valley floor
water polluted by runoffs from farmland

shortDefinitions: water or other material that drains freely off surface of something
